Description: During a battle, once this fighter's gang has failed a Bottle test, during any End phase in which this fighter passes its Cool check and does not flee the battlefield, any friendly fighters with the same origin that are within 12" of this fighter will automatically pass their Cool check and will not flee the battlefield.

During a battle, once this fighter's gang has failed a Bottle test, during any End phase in which this fighter passes its Cool check and does not flee the battlefield, any friendly fighters with the same origin that are within 6" of this fighter will automatically pass their Cool check and will not flee the battlefield.

When a fighter with this special rule is activated, their controlling player can choose to activate a number of additional Ready fighters with the same origin within 3", up to the number shown in brackets. The controlling player must nominate all of the fighters who will be activated as part of the Group Activation before any of them is activated. Once they have been nominated, fighters are activated one at a time, not simultaneously. Additional fighters with this special rule may not themselves use this special rule during this activation.
Should a fighter with this special rule be Seriously Injured or be taken Out of Action, friendly fighters that are within 3" do not have to take a Nerve test, unless they also have this special rule.
A psyker with this skill may re-roll a failed Willpower test once per battle.

Should a psyker with this skill be taken Out of Action, the enemy gang is rewarded a bounty of D3x10 credits at the end of the battle. Should a psyker with this skill be captured and sold to the Guilders, they are worth their full value. Note that when a psyker with this skill is captured, they can be sold immediately without the opportunity for a Rescue Mission.

When a friendly Psyker uses a Psychoteric Wyrd Power (Darkness, Delusion or Madness), up to 3 other Active friendly Faction fighters within 3" of the Psyker can give 1 modifier each in all of the following situations: Increased Range: +1" range to any Psychoteric Wyrd Power (max +3"). Harder to resist: -1 modifier to enemy Intelligence tests to resist any Psychoteric Wyrd Power (min -3).

Can be placed aside instead of being set up at the start of a battle. Deployment: Start of any of any round after the first (before rolling for Priority).Anywhere on the battlefield. Outside 6" and LOS of any enemy fighters. If both gangs have fighters with this special rule, take turns, starting with the winner of a roll-off.

Pass a Willpower test to target this fighter with a Fight (Basic) or Shoot (Basic) action, or the action ends immediately (wasted). However, the action does not count as being performed, so the same action can be attempted again, if the fighter has more available actions in the activation.

If an enemy wishes to make a Charge (Double) action that would result in them making one or more close combat attacks against this fighter, they must make a Willpower test before moving. If the test is failed, they cannot move and their activation ends immediately.
Charge distance is Move + D6” (instead of D3”).
Extend LoS to 360° when making Fight (Basic) action with Versatile weapons.
When this fighter makes close combat attacks as part of a Charge (Double) action, they roll one additional Attack dice.
All attacks have Reckless. After a target is Seriously Injured or taken Out of Action, roll 2+ or immediately gain Insanity.

(Scrapcode-Corrupted Ambot): If Captured and not rescued, the capturing gang has the following options depending on alignment: Law Abiding: Sold as normal. Outlaw: Sold for full cost (Black Market). Added to the gang for free (if having sufficient Reputation to take an extra Hanger-on).
Can re-roll Rally tests if the result is 2 (before modifiers).
Can re-roll Nerve tests if the result is 2 (before modifiers).
Once per battle, can re-roll a Threshold test to perform an Act of Faith (all dice must be re-rolled).

At the end of the Choose Crew step of the pre-battle sequence, one additional Ganger with this rule may be added to the starting crew, even if this increases the size of the gang beyond the scenario limit.

At the end of the Choose Crew step of the pre-battle sequence, D3 additional Juves with this rule may be added to the starting crew, even if this increases the size of the gang beyond the scenario limit.
This fighter must choose a Path of Faith when they are added to the gang. (see House of Faith pages 97-105)
This fighter must always be equipped with a vehicle.

When this fighter is activated, 1 visible Faction fighter within 6” gains the Nerves of Steel skill (if not already having it). +2 modifier to any Bottle test while at least one friendly fighter with this ability is on the battlefield.
Toxin weapons can re-roll 1s before modifiers (against Toughness).
Fighters may not perform the Aim (Basic) action or fire weapons with the Unwieldy trait while they are embarked in a Transport Cage with Fire Points.

While embarked in a transport cage, a fighter is treated as if they are not on the battlefield, so cannot be the target of any attacks or use any abilities. If any fighters are embarked on a vehicle when it is Wrecked, they must be placed Prone within 1" of the vehicle’s final position and then suffer a S4, AP -, D1 hit. Any fighter that cannot be placed in this way is taken Out of Action – immediately make a roll on the Lasting Injury table for them. All friendly fighters can perform the Embark (Basic) and Disembark (Basic) actions: Embark (Basic): If this fighter is within 1" of a transport cage’s access point, remove them from the battlefield. They are now embarked in the transport cage. Disembark (Basic): If this fighter is embarked in a transport cage, place them within 1" of the transport cage’s access point and at least 1" away from any enemy fighters. This may mean that fighters cannot disembark from a transport cage.
For every 1" a wheeled vehicle moves through difficult terrain, it counts as having moved 2".
Ignore movement penalties when moving over difficult terrain.
Ignore all difficult & dangerous terrain. If ending an activation on difficult or dangerous terrain, pass a Handling test or suffer a Catastrophic hit to the Drive.
Make any amount of turns during an activation. For every 1" a walker moves through difficult terrain, it counts as having moved 2".
